PageTitle: nat alarm ip threshold (Global CGN address pool view)
FuncDef:
The nat alarm ip threshold command configures the alarm threshold for a global address pool.
The undo nat alarm ip threshold command cancels the configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold of a global address pool is 80%.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an alarm threshold for address usage in a global address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from 60 to 100, in percentage. The default value is 80.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the address usage of a global address pool is greater than or equal to the alarm threshold, an address usage threshold-crossing alarm is generated. When the address usage of the global address pool is less than or equal to 7/8 of the alarm threshold, an address usage clear alarm is generated.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
